title: Facilities Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical interview process for government job positions. Human Resources called first and had a thirty minute phone interview. Then I was brought in to meet with the hiring manager and the team for a total of two hours.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Simple and personalized. Come prepared to answer questions on your degree and future plans of what you want to do with it. Great opportunity ahead for anyone looking to start their new Adventure!
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Straight-forward, relaxed, & smooth. Come prepared to talk about your experience. Highlight your strengths, and talk about ways you have learned from your mistakes. I was able to relate a lot of the duties to former positions in my career and volunteer experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell us about relayed experience to this role.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Group activities. The interviewer says/asks something and everyone will go around the room discussing it. Be outgoing, engage, and show up on time and you will likely get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy no hard questions. took total 30 minutes. Everything else was fine and welcoming. they asked about my experience and interests and they wanted me to present my previous works as graduate student. overall they were looking for someone who is interested and have minimum knowledge.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this field?

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Comforting and welcoming staff that made me feel like they valued my time and answers. I was able to expand on my experience and display how I can benefit from being a member of the team.
Interview Questions: Q: describe your previous work experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy chat with faculty. No pressure. Felt more like an open conversation than an interview. I was very candid and honest and that seemed to engage them in more conversation. Lasted about 1 hour and heard back a week later.
Interview Questions: What have been your favorite classes?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process for this position. All I had to do was simply talk to the professor whom I wanted to assist and asked for the opportunity to work with them.
Interview Questions: What grade did I receive for that class?

title: ISU Dining Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions:
You apply online to the place you're willing to work for. 

Then they'll give you a call and ask when you are available for an interview. 

It's a phone interview and they ask question about yourself.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work with ISU Dining?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview discussing how you would approach different situations and how you interact with others. Simply scenario games were conducted but what was more important was the reasoning behind certain actions.
Interview Questions: How would interact with a student that just wanted a tutor to review information?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Met with variety of committees, including but not limited to students, faculty, staff, and senior level administrators. There was an open forum component to the interview. The time with students did not include any full time staff which allowed for students to be transparent about their concerns and what they were looking for in a coordinator.
Interview Questions: What skill sets do you bring to support the land grant mission?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very basic 10 to 15  minutes phone interview after I submitted my application. They try to work with my classes and my other conflicts outside of my classes. Loved it.
Interview Questions:
Any conflicts?
where do you live?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: They ask a thorough interview about your work and research. They ask you about your past research work and publications. Then you have to give presentations and show them your academic record.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations from the job?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Submit the cv and wait for the zoom interview. The lab PI interviewed me via zoom, which took about 1 hour. The first part is the presentation of my previous research. After my presentation, the PI asked some questions. Afterward, the PI offered me the job.
Interview Questions: How is your previous work relates to our lab?

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers created a very inviting and warm environment. Conversation was natural and low pressure. The questions posed were not rigorous yet informative. I am very satisfied with my experience thus far.
Interview Questions: When working in a team environment, how do you handle conflict?

title: Small Animal Caretaker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met in person, had the interview, then took a tour of the facility.  Learned about where things were, what a day would look like, what is expected of me, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why we should hire you.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and casual. A comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. More like getting to know one another rather than feeling like I was being assessed. I went through two rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this lab?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Three days to one week process. Minimum grade for chosen subject required. General interview questions in a group setting. Orientations and workshops prior to starting date are available.  Great on-campus part-time job.
Interview Questions: What will your tutoring session look like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Really a very basic and conversational interview. Very little technical questions. Great tour of the labs and facilities. I had a good time despite not being really prepared for the interview.
Interview Questions: What kinds of projects are you working on?

title: ISU Student Dining Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was chill, easy going, I am doing fine, they are being nice and kind to me, I am happy and got the job, and become a student supervisor
Interview Questions: What is your strength in handling task?

title: Environmental Assessment and Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Candidates are recruited into specific Options. Please choose up to two of the specialist Options, drawn from the selection offered by the MSc, that you want to apply for. These should be ranked in order of preference. If you are unsuccessful with your first Option choice your application will be passed onto the convenor of your second choice Option for consideration.
Interview Questions:
introduce your self 
why IC

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person with simple coding and problem solving questions. Layer back and casual attire. Answered about 6 questions during interview. Interviewer was very nice and helped a lot.
Interview Questions: Big O times of various sorts

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: They do look your qualification and if matches they hire you. There is no formal process , however a Professor may want to chat with you about your experiences and go through your resume.
Interview Questions: There were no questions other than what was my interest?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick and efficient. The interviewer was very kind and great at communicating the job description. The interview felt very relaxed and comforting and did not feel to pressured during the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with managing a team?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The questions asked were situational Questions on how you would handle difficult customer calls and customer service skills. My interview was on Zoom and I believe it is a two interview process before getting hired
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry caller?

title: IT Applications Developer- Systems Analyst I/II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Got a call within 2 weeks of applying. Process was fairly simple but very repetitive.

1. Phone call with HR about salary expectations and other related behavioral questions.
2. Phone interview with team members. Questions were about the experience I have in regard to the job requirements. They basically asked if I have experience in the different technologies they work on. Also asked a few behavioral questions.
3. Virtual interview with team members. This was a video interview and the questions were exactly same as in the  previous interview. I found this one to be very un-necessary because there was hardly anything new. The only new things asked waere java questions. They asked to write the code for them in the chat window.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with team members?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: ZOOM interview (1 hr) then full-day on campus with a presentation. It was a long process from the initial interview to offer. The system was very slow then. The speed sometimes is determined by the people involved in the hiring.
Interview Questions: what are your experiences advising students in higher education?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: it was great, at first, it was intimating but after I just start to talk with them it really goes well. I  have prepared well and they have asked me to start to talk with one of my project that I want, After that, they asked me about my background, and then they started to talk about their company
Interview Questions: Tell us about your most (or least) successful UX design project

title: Seed Science Center IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the hiring manager of the Seed Science Center IT branch and was asked basic questions about handling hardware and software solutions for the workstations on-site. Nothing was too difficult. If you have been around computers for a long time and comfortable with working with Windows 10 in general then this job should be fine.
Interview Questions: How is RAM put on a motherboard?

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process followed four unique projects focused in communication, leadership, engineering, and basic algebra skills. The interviewer appeared calm and willing to cooperate with the student to help the interview run smoothly.
Interview Questions: Please explain recursion to me from the perspective of a teacher.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Send an email and got a reply without an interview.  My supervisor did ask reference from my supervisor in China who is so nice to help me get this wonderful chance.
Interview Questions: Do you have funding

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Day long schedule with individual interviews with boss and boss' boss, group interviews with constituents, and a presentation on a topic relevant to audience. Included interviews with peers over meals that allow me a chance to ask more detailed questions.
Interview Questions: What was my relevant experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple. Not many questions. Simply contact the professor via email beforehand. The professor sent me a link for application. He also suggested me some book to read before starting working with him.
Interview Questions: Talk more about your background and master's thesis.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: the prof contacted me through email and we scheduled a phone interview. talked about her research and my interests to make sure they are aligned!asked me technical questions about my previous research and the course work
Interview Questions: related to my research interests

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in Dec 2015. Called the department secretory to make sure all the materials were complete right after submission. There was a campus visit, but I did not make it for some reason. Offer received in Feb-March 2016. No phone interview unexpectedly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. The interviewer asked questions pertaining to the job and allowed for direct answers. No trick questions. The interview process was very quick with a turn around within the hour. Would highly recommend.
Interview Questions: Qualifications Interest in subject area

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple, they brought me in to help out some graduate students with their research. They asked me a few questions about my abilities and gave me the job right there.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have with this software?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. Only the application is required with the cv. The GPA from the Bachelors degree is informed. And the interested field and the groups were included in the SOP.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Testing Center Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online questionnaire about yourself and values. There was a total of like seven questions. All of which were about how you would react to different situations, as well as what you value and why you should be hired.
Interview Questions: What would you do if these certain incidents occurred?  Why do you feel you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: simple hiring process, filled in some documents, employer asked a few questions and then a week later the employer emailed me that i got the job and asked when i could start working
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the Supervisors within the conservation project (Monarch rearing and research). I learned about what they do and its importance. And after our discussions I received a tour of the facility. After the interview it was important to them that I was able to work with them as a team so it took a week or so to know that I had a firm position with them.
Interview Questions: What do I want to accomplish in the future and do you think that this position will have any benefit to that?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Process was well organized. The faculty was very friendly. The department chair has a strong opinion. The campus is quite large, while the internal research facilities are not advanced.
Interview Questions: Why ISU?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: They did Skype interview.  First, they made a schedule with me. Because of the time difference, I had to do it at night. There were two interviewers asking questions about  myself, my teaching  context, my future plans, the classess that I will be teaching etc.
Interview Questions: What is your plan here?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: No interview. They just check application form and based on that give the job.  So get a good gpa  and get some recommendations from professors. Do research with a professor and he may recommend you.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief fifteen minute interview with a week after interview for call back. Asked about ten to fifteen short questions that were very easy to answer. Assistant managers interview and trade off asking you questions about how you would handle issues the student supervisor might come across.
Interview Questions: Greatest strengths?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: After submitting application materials, I had a skype interview followed by an on-campus interview that lasted fr 2-2.5 days - it had a job talk, several one-one meetings, and 2-3 meetings with search committee and other groups.
Interview Questions: What courses can I teach at undergrad and grad levels

title: IT Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an interview after a week. I was interviewed by security director and 2 other senior security analysts. Was an easy interview where they told me what their roles were and what security tools they use. One of the interviewer (senior security analyst) was very unprofessional, he was using his mac to text and seemed uninterested. After I said I only have one more semester left before graduation. It was clear they did not want me. They hurried and wrapped it up after.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Can you tell me your experience with Splunk?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: It's a short phone call asking about what your class schedule is like, and if you have ever had a job before. Honestly anyone could work at this place so long as you are a felon.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule?

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Job is very easy to get. I simply emailed the man in charge stating that I was looking for a job. He emailed me back right away and we set up an interview!
Interview Questions: What is my availability?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was given in a group setting. We were given various tutor-tutee situations and asked to respond with an appropriate action. We were allowed to consult with the other candidates as well.
Interview Questions: Why is it important for you to understand the material you are tutoring?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The position and its requirements were emailed and then I applied online.I got a telephonic interview in next few days and was asked about my education,skills and background.I got an offer after a couple of days.
Interview Questions:
What is my experience with MS Excel?
What is my experience with MS Access?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They have good hiring process. Interview was easy but further background check process took some time. There were some skill - set questions and behavioral questions. First interview was through video call then 1 -1 for another round.
Interview Questions: Some behavioral questions.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They give hypothetical scenarios in which you are tested on how you would handle different tutees with different personalities. You are paired up in groups and are made to match hypothetical actions to hypothetical situations.
Interview Questions: What active learning method would you use?

title: Student Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Online application and hire. Didn't have to do anything other than fill out an online form. It was pretty easy. For the most part, to get hired as a Student Assistant Manager, you have to already be working there.
Interview Questions: None - simply online application

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I just had a phone interview. Part 1 of the interview process. If selected to go further I would interview in person next. I applied for the job on the Iowa State University job page and it took almost a month before they contacted me about an interview. I heard this is common though with these educational institutions.
Interview Questions: What is important to me as a graphic designer when creating a website?

title: Associate Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a 30 phone interview with the interview team.  The finalists were asked to campus for a 4 hour interview that included various groups of people that the incumbent would interact with regularly should they be chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: Why Iowa State, and why this position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Long Beach, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I didn't really have an interview.  I submitted an application after I met my eventual mentor at a professional conference (I guess that was my interview).  My conversation with him at the conference was very low key, as we just talked generally about some of the things that we were doing with our work/research.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: There was no actual interview. They look at your application and accept or reject you based on that.  This means that you merely have to compete against everyone else in the application pool.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know previous teaching experience, which is hard to come by during an undergrad degree.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: it was a video conference interview for about 30 min. It was mainly technical, about my previous M.Sc. research work. then I was asked about some logistics because i was an international student
Interview Questions: Most of the question was purely technical and was expected

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Ask about the UI and how to design the website, introduce the idea of how to create the website and provide your own creativity, expected salary, and time to work
Interview Questions: Describe your project

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Formal phone interview. 3 people from the group were there.There were no technical questions. All about behavioral questions. For example, how do you manage when things are so busy? How do you deal with a challenge?
Interview Questions: How do you manage when things are so busy? How do you deal with a challenge?

title: Cashier/Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There was an application submission prior and then a sit down interview. Being that there are several locations on campus and thousands of students needing to be served they were pretty open to giving me the job, but asked what my past experience had been anyway.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job?

title: Service Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: A brief personal interview with a couple technical questions followed by another interview with managers that is mostly personal.  It is generally a brief process and apart from paperwork you can expect to be working only a few days after being called to come in for the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you solve a problem with your computer?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Application package with all requirements, including GRE and TOEFL.  Then got to identify professors whose work I was interested in and who were taking students.  Finally, professor contacted me for a phone interview and that's how the process kicked off until I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my research area?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Only need to submit the resume and personal statement. They will rate  candidates based on resume. This does not need to take too much time. Again, it is a university position only rate the candidate based on previous experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. Just submit your application with GPA on the form. And then wait for several days for an email response. If your GPA is really high, no worries, you will get the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and applicants took turns to answer questions. The interviewer was the head of the Academic Success Department, and she was very friendly and made the effort to make sure we were relaxed at the beginning of the interview. The questions were not very difficult, but make sure to center around what you as a potential employee could provide to their department, as opposed to saying what you could gain from working with them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by four women who worked in the department in the board room. They were all very nice and inviting.The interview took about 30 minutes. They let me know by an e-mail that I had received the position two days after.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked personal questions about us and why we wanted to work in IT.  They were mainly looking for student employees which wanted to assist with IT services around campus.
Interview Questions: What is Malware? Where would you go to find a solution if unknown right away? O.S. experience (Mac, Windows, Linux)

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very formal. First you submit an extensive online form, answering questions, having a cover letter, resume and detailed background on your past legal encounters (even speeding tickets). You then wait and you will be invited for a phone interview to narrow down the candidates. From there, the final candidates had 3 different interviews with the members of the search committee.  This included a panel interview, and two separate 1-1 interviews with members of the committee who were unable to make it to the scheduled group interview.

then you wait for the decision. It was very intense.
Interview Questions: How would you expect to instill ethics and deal with potential conflicts of interests when surveying companies that may have an advantage of their competitors in the same industry they are entering?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions from the professor. I was asked details and my understanding of technical details relating to the job. I was a part of the aerospace engineering department and did work as a research assistant.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Engineering Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a personal relationship with my professor, so he approached me to see if I was interested in working for him over the summer.   I  later had an interview with him and a couple of other professors, mainly to gauge what my interests were and what type of work I might be doing.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The application website worked smoothly and was easy to use. I liked the way it was designed. I got a phone call directly giving me an offer.
Interview Questions: Education, background, skills

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was just a small face to face interview. The professor asked few technical questions and asked about my research experience. I had to tell about my research, publications and projects.
Interview Questions: Basic technical questions, publications and research experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: Communicated through email. Interviewed for summer position on PHP, Java and SQL. It also involved questions on my previous experience and interest to learn new technologies. After that, I was selected and asked to choose the number of work hours. From here, it went smoothly. They liked my work and continued my contract and the research assistant position. Now, I am building tools useful for my thesis as well as my job.
Interview Questions: To prove that you can learn new technologies

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: professor for signal and system class, asked me about the fourier transfer and how can I get the formula. also, some knowledge about matlab. it is a short interview, and me and professor talked very well. because i got A for this class and my gpa is good, so i got the position
Interview Questions: fourier trnsfer; matlab

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my application on the ASC website. I got approved to come in for an interview a few days later. It was very easy. It was with a group of 5 or 6 people, and we all answered the same basic questions. We were emailed by the end of the week saying if we got the job or not.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on running a session with difficult students?

title: Mosquito Surveillance Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very casual. This is a University position so there is a wonderful culture of allowing students the opportunity to work and gain experience while rejecting as few people as possible. The interview consisted essentially of a job description, and the hiring manager asking if it would be something you're interested in. It would be helpful to take the mosquito surveillance laboratory.
Interview Questions: Do you have any entomological experience?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview to be a research assistant at ISU is pretty liberal. The best bet is to do well in a class with a professor that is doing research and talk to them about joining their lab from there. Another option is to e-mail professors that are doing research that you may be interested in. I find that often times, professors will take you on even if they don't need the help because they see your passion.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the research that I am conducting?

title: Communication Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Although this was not a faculty position, the interview process was structured very much like an academic interview. There were three separate interviews in one afternoon--one with the team and leading manager, one with a representative from each of the departments, and one with the department chair. The team was very friendly and personable.
Interview Questions: One of the department members asked how I would manage conflicting demands between the departments when multiple were vying for time. It wasn't a difficult question, but it was unexpected. It was difficult to provide an answer without knowing the official policy of the actual media team.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview. Each interview with a supervisor and another Resident Advisor. Before they call you to the interview room you meet other CAs and other applicants. They have changed the hiring process now and it is completely different. You work with other applicants to solve a problem and present it to the pannel and then everyone goes around the pannel answering questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a CA?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
not much after applying for the graduate school. You may need to contact with the professor first, which would definitely arise the opportunity to get into the program. 
After you get the offer, there would be a campus visit. Take this chance to talk to the professors and the have a trip to the labs. Find something attract you before you make the decision.
When you decided to take the offer. prepare for the graduate school. again, contact with the professor would help.
Interview Questions: what kind of language you use for programming?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process consisted of an initial phone interview with the VP.  Subsequently invited for an onsite interview, which involved key executives from different areas of the organization--started with VP and ended with VP.  Invited back for a third group interview with the individuals whom I would be supervising.
Interview Questions: Most questions were standard fare, plus a lot of questions intended to measure whether there would be a cultural fit--one big happy team vs silos & importance of transparency.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Spoke with Prof. 
Expressed interest as a freshman. 
Elaborated need to gain practical lab experience. 
Expressed interest to work in the summer, but wanted to gain semester long experience to prove my competence.
Interview Questions: Why apply as a freshman instead of waiting to gain more lab experience through classes?

title: Families Field Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a group of 6 people and presented a lesson. I was required to pick a topic pertaining to the job I was interviewing for and present a 10 minute lesson on that topic.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths?  How do you work with others different from you?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: interviewed one time, got a call 2 years later that I could have the job if I wanted it. I was certified and needed some pocket money so I took it.
Interview Questions: are you certified?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was not that bad at all. they want to know that you're reliable and punctual. The also want to check/ see if you can handle pressure situations and how you will handle them
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Call Center Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the university job board and was contacted for a 2 tier interview process, once on phone and the other in person.
Interview Questions: 'What according to you is good customer service?'

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Is a very involved process with lots of stake holders.  Department Chair, Dean, then your peers.  The deliberation process was also very long.  Do not get frustrated by the wait time, there is a lot of bureaucracy to wade through to be able to offer a job at ISU.
Interview Questions: What has been your greatest success?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very laid off 1:1 in campus interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever experience working ethics? If so, how did you handle it?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: phone interview first, then go on-site giving a mini lectures, meet students and faculty for a whole day then got the offer after 2 weeks, then I declined the offer because I got other better offer from other place. I would recommend this school to other candidates if they like to tech and peaceful enviroment.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I presented my PhD work and there was a brief question and answer session. They knew me already from my work and I had a collaboration with them, I also got a strong recommendation from my PhD supervisor, so I got the offer pretty easily.
Interview Questions: my PhD thesis

title: Program Assistant 11 Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Iowa State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with all the other employees at the table. It was a little intemidating but went well. Then got a call back to meet with supervisor only. Was told I got the job and started my training.
Interview Questions: Wanted to know what I knew about the agencies in the community.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at the Iowa State Memorial Union website and within a few days I received an email about an interview. I was asked questions about my communication and customer service skills, notified about the pay and given the job during the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with customer service?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sent my cover letter about the postdoc position. And after I got email back from my PI, I had a conference call with my PI. My PI asked me my background and my experiences in detail. After then, my PI introduced what this position was supposed to do in the current project. My PI asked me again about my feeling and how I could do this. So I think I answered quiet well.
Interview Questions: What is your future plan in US? What if you get a trouble with your team members?

title: Student Job Board Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a formal interview with the supervisor and two student supervisors following a brief phone screen. The questions were very appropriate to the position. There were some challenging questions, but nothing unexpected.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite aspect of being a student at Iowa State?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The IT Solution Center, 192 Parks Library, provides direct support for IT Services customers and acts as a single point of contact for problem resolution. Its mission is to help the people of Iowa State University with supported computer software, networking, and service issues.It was good
Interview Questions: Behavioral interview

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly atmosphere, Interviewed with two employers, More conversation-like. I sent an email applying for the position through the Iowa State student job board and received a response within the week to schedule an interview. Once I got to the interview, the people in the office were very relaxed and just wanted to know if I would be a good fit with their group.
Interview Questions: They posed me with a potential situation that could take place in the office. Example: What would you do if someone was coming in looking for a professor?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submission of current class schedule and resume/cover letter along with current transcript. After submission, I waited about a week to hear back for an interview. An interview date was set up. I went to the interview and was asked questions about my academic experience and then shown around the lab as well as the green house. I was then told there were more prospective interviews. A few days later i got an email saying i got the job!
Interview Questions: What is your major and why are you interested in this lab

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Iowa State University in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit a resume and cover letter specific to academia. The interview consisted of an informal 1:1 discussing skills, interests, and technology used to complete the job. Be flexible with a schedule. Assistantships come in 1/4, 2/4, or 3/4 witch translates to 10, 20, and 30 hours. You will have to find time to fit it in with your class schedule.
Interview Questions: Look for opportunities outside of your home department.

title: Student Services Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on the ISU website. It was more than a month before I heard a word from anyone at the University. Received a phone call to see if I was still available & interested in the position. Since I was they wanted to know where I expected to be salary-wise, to make sure that continuing the process wouldn't be a waste of both of our time. My demand was compatible with what they had available, so was told to expect a call to schedule an interview, which I did a week later. My interview finally took place a few days shy of 2 months after I originally applied for the position. Actually consisted of a 3 hour series of interviews with a total of 10 people: 1 on 1 with the department director, then a panel of several of the department staff, then with a few members of faculty & staff from other areas of the college, 1 on 1 with an associate dean, then back with the department director again. Mostly it seemed that everyone's goal was to see if I was a good fit. Didn't get many questions regarding technical abilities. More about why I wanted to work in an academic setting, what areas of my private sector experience would translate well, etc.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be your biggest challenge in this position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interned first as an undergrad, then a graduate assistantship opened up and I was offered to interview. To obtain the internship, I personally contacted the department head, and interviewed in their office a week later. After working for half a year, was extended the opportunity to interview for graduate assistantship.
Interview Questions: What innovative, new, pro-active processes and ways of thinking could I bring to the organization?

title: Structural Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the Lab manager and asked to come into his office at a curtain date to discuss the job. After arriving, I had a short discussion with him about my past experience and how many hours I could work each week. Also, I had to read a short booklet on safety in the lab.
Interview Questions: Can you lift 50 lbs?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: You meet with the prof you want to work with and discuss the work. You could do a rotation which would give a good idea of job description. This rotation also gives you a opportunity to impress your prof with your skills.
Interview Questions: How can you improve/contribute to this field?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had to take a speak teach test in which I had to teach a mock class a biological concept. I was graded on my verbal skills and ability to clearly get across to the class.
Interview Questions: Questions on introductory genetics

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviews for faculty positions in most places are simply conversations in addition to giving a talk or two. That is also the case at Iowa State. Many meetings with faculty members. It does not need any preparation as such in my opinion.
Interview Questions: What are your future career plans?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was typical. give a talk and meet many people. people may not be judging you but be professional, who knows when something fires back. show interest in their work.
Interview Questions: nothing is particular. they ask about research and stuff

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: First I had to take the GRE, and they looked at my GPA. I had a meeting with the head of the department, and I met with graduate students and a few faculty members. They were nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to study here?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was not long enough: only minutes. I did not have enough time to answer the questions they raised. Too rush.
Interview Questions: What did you do in the past in teaching that you would want to change and why?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor with whom I was interested in working. After discussing possible research projects and identifying where our interests overlapped, I was selected for the position. The interview process was informal as much was determined via email before meeting in person.
Interview Questions: N/A. The initial step of identifying and approaching a professor was most difficult.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Started with an online skype interview and got selected as i have good CV to support necessary research credentials for performing this job. Basic questions on behavior and problem solving abilities
Interview Questions: NA

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Sent an email to the professor. No interview needed. Looked at my grade in the class and hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about youself
Interview Questions: explain something in your paper

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line they called me with in the week to have a phone interview. He asked me some general questions, then we simulated what it would be like talking on the phone to alumni. He asked me why do I think it is important to get people to people to give money to Iowa State.
Interview Questions: Why is it important to give to Iowa State?

title: Principal Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Talk with investigator and he know what I can do, then he gave me the offer
Interview Questions: what's your computer skill

title: IT Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Met with a couple of managers. They asked a few basic IT questions along with other questions that you would normally see on an ACT exam.
Interview Questions: Tell us 5 different things you can do with this paper clip.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Emailed about a job posting on university job search.  Asked for resume and any other relevant info.  Met for a 1:1 interview explaining the type of research they do, and what I'd be doing.  Asked for the hours I was available.  Got an e-mail back within a week asking me to come in for my first day.  Very casual, dressed in my normal college student attire, everyone in lab was dressed the same.
Interview Questions: Biggest weakness?

title: Academic Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: The process is typical for higher education.  Start off with a phone interview in which you’re asked what has attracted you to the position.  You’re asked a series of written questions about your knowledge of the position.  Most often the phone interview is to provide you information and to see what your true interest is in the position.  If you’re able to articulate that clearly you make it to the second phase of the process.  On campus interview which is a daylong interview meeting with several committees and ending which a presentation on your philosophy of higher education.  For the most part only one or two people are going to make the decision.
Interview Questions: How do you work with people different than yourself?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a faculty member and then flown in for two days of interviews.  The process is pretty standard:  meet with faculty both days and give an hour-long seminar to the faculty and graduate students.
Interview Questions: Faculty interviews are all about making impressions with the current faculty and convincing them you are a good fit for the department.  If you have a hot research area, that's a huge plus.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: normal college application process for PhD
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Iowa State University (Ames, IA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: just contacted a professor and show interest in  her research area. She offered me research assistant position after looking at my resume.
Interview Questions: what kind of research project you were involved in? show me a copy of your paper.
